name: Quick Chicken and Corn Chowder
author: drrckbr
summary: Healthy chicken and corn chowder! Vegetable broth can be used instead of chicken broth. Canned corn can be used instead of frozen corn.
ingredients: 8 ounces skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces
½ cup chopped red bell pepper
1 tablespoon cornstarch, or more as needed
1 cup white beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; saute chicken, onion, red bell pepper, and garlic until chicken is no longer pink in the center and onion is tender, 3 to 5 minutes
Add chicken broth and corn to chicken mixture
Whisk milk and cornstarch together in a bowl until dissolved; stir into soup
Bring soup to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until thickened, about 15 minutes
Stir white beans, Cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper into soup; simmer until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes
